tiles.title: The latest Netezza release introduces native support for Cloud Object Storage (COS), enabling scalable data management beyond traditional storage formats. Netezza Bring Your Own Cloud (BYOC) is now generally available on Azure, allowing secure deployment within customer-managed VPCs. Additionally, Netezza Software supports Bring Your Own Orchestration, offering flexible deployment on customer hardware or Red Hat OpenShift with scalable architecture for analytics and AI workloads. To enhance security, SSL/TLS connections now require server certificate validation using the caCertFile parameter across ODBC, JDBC, and nzsql clients.

Netezza introduces enhanced cloud integration, security, and table management features—including REST catalog support for Iceberg, Azure Gen2 compatibility, customer-managed encryption keys, and AWS Marketplace availability—alongside new notification capabilities for NPSaaS users.

Introduced Iceberg enhancements for improved table operations and data management, along with new Database Assistant skills for deeper insights into user activity, query performance, data distribution, and access control.
Database Assistant is now generally available on AWS and Azure, and the Netezza JDBC driver has been updated with enhanced security through JRE 15.0.2 and Kerberos support.
